verses.verse: For Yahweh <WH3068> will have compassion <WH7355> on Jacob, <WH3290> and will yet choose <WH977> Israel, <WH3478> and set <WH3240> them in their own land. <WH127> The foreigner <WH1616> will join <WH3867> himself with them, <WH5596> and they will unite with the house <WH1004> of Jacob. <WH3290>

The peoples <WH5971> will take <WH3947> them, <WH935> and bring them to their place. <WH4725> The house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478> will possess <WH5157> them in Yahweh <WH3068>'s land <WH127> for servants <WH5650> and for handmaids. <WH8198> They will take as captives <WH7617> those whose captives <WH7617> they were; <WH7287> and they shall rule over their oppressors. <WH5065>

It will happen in the day <WH3117> that Yahweh <WH3068> will give you rest <WH5117> from your sorrow, <WH6090> from your trouble, <WH6090> and from the hard <WH7186> service <WH5656> in which you were made to serve, <WH5647>

that you will take up <WH5375> this parable <WH4912> against the king <WH4428> of Babylon, <WH894> and say, <WH559> "How the oppressor <WH5065> has ceased! <WH7673> The golden city <WH4062> has ceased! <WH7673>"
Yahweh <WH3068> has broken <WH7665> the staff <WH4294> of the wicked, <WH7563> the scepter <WH7626> of the rulers, <WH4910>

who struck <WH5221> the peoples <WH5971> in wrath <WH5678> with a continual <WH1115> stroke, <WH4347> who ruled <WH7287> the nations <WH1471> in anger, <WH639> with a persecution <WH4783> that none <WH1097> restrained. <WH2820>
The whole earth <WH776> is at rest, <WH5117> and is quiet. <WH8252> They break out <WH6476> song. <WH7440>
Yes, <WH1265> the fir trees rejoice <WH8055> with you, <WH730> with the cedars of Lebanon, <WH3844> saying, <WH7901> "Since you are humbled, no lumberjack <WH3772> has come up against us. <WH5927>"

Sheol <WH7585> from beneath has moved <WH7264> for you to meet <WH7125> you at your coming. <WH935> It stirs up <WH5782> the dead <WH7496> for you, <WH6260> even all the rulers of the earth. <WH776> It has raised up <WH6965> from their thrones <WH3678> all the kings <WH4428> of the nations. <WH1471>
They all will answer <WH6030> and ask <WH559> you, <WH2470> "Have you also become as weak as we are? <WH4911> Have you become like us?"

Your pomp <WH1347> is brought down <WH3381> to Sheol, <WH7585> with the sound <WH1998> of your stringed instruments. <WH5035> Maggots <WH7415> are spread <WH3331> out under you, <WH7415> and worms cover you. <WH4374>

How you have fallen <WH5307> from heaven, <WH8064> morning star, <WH1966> son <WH1121> of the dawn! <WH7837> How you are cut down <WH1438> to the ground, <WH776> who laid the nations <WH1471> low! <WH2522>

You said <WH559> in your heart, <WH3824> "I will ascend <WH5927> into heaven! <WH8064> I will exalt <WH7311> my throne <WH3678> above <WH4605> the stars <WH3556> of God! <WH410> I will sit <WH3427> on the mountain <WH2022> of assembly, <WH4150> in the far <WH3411> north! <WH6828>
I will ascend <WH5927> above the heights <WH1116> of the clouds! <WH5645> I will make myself like <WH1819> the Most High! <WH5945>"
Yet you shall be brought down <WH3381> to Sheol, <WH7585> to the depths <WH3411> of the pit. <WH953>

Those who see <WH7200> you will stare <WH7688> at you. <WH995> They will ponder you, <WH376> saying, "Is this the man who made the earth <WH776> to tremble, <WH7264> who shook <WH7493> kingdoms; <WH4467>
who made <WH7760> the world <WH8398> like a wilderness, <WH4057> and overthrew <WH2040> its cities; <WH5892> who didn't <WH6605> release his prisoners <WH615> to their home? <WH1004>"
All the kings <WH4428> of the nations, <WH1471> sleep <WH7901> in glory, <WH3519> everyone <WH376> in his own house. <WH1004>

But you are cast away <WH7993> from your tomb <WH6913> like an abominable <WH8581> branch, <WH5342> clothed <WH3830> with the slain, <WH2026> who are thrust through <WH2944> with the sword, <WH2719> who go down <WH3381> to the stones <WH68> of the pit; <WH953> like a dead body <WH6297> trodden under foot. <WH947>

You will not join <WH3161> them in burial, <WH6900> because you have destroyed <WH7843> your land. <WH776> You have killed <WH2026> your people. <WH5971> The seed <WH2233> of evildoers <WH7489> will not be named <WH7121> forever. <WH5769>

Prepare <WH3559> for slaughter <WH4293> of his children <WH1121> because of the iniquity <WH5771> of their fathers, <WH1> that they not <WH1077> rise <WH6965> up and possess <WH3423> the earth, <WH776> and fill <WH4390> the surface <WH6440> of the world <WH8398> with cities. <WH6145>

"I will rise up <WH6965> against them, <WH5002>" says Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies, <WH6635> "and cut off <WH3772> from Babylon <WH894> name <WH8034> and remnant, <WH7605> and son <WH5209> and son <WH5220>'s son," says <WH5002> Yahweh. <WH3068>

"I will also make <WH7760> it a possession <WH4180> for the porcupine, <WH7090> and pools <WH98> of water. <WH4325> I will sweep <WH2894> it with the broom <WH4292> of destruction, <WH8045>" says <WH5002> Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies. <WH6635>
Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies <WH6635> has sworn, <WH7650> saying, <WH559> "Surely, <WH1819> as I have thought, so shall it happen; <WH3289> and as I have purposed, so shall it stand: <WH6965>

that I will break <WH7665> the Assyrian <WH804> in my land, <WH776> and tread him under foot <WH947> on my mountains. <WH2022> Then his yoke <WH5923> will leave <WH5493> them, <WH5448> and his burden leave <WH5493> their shoulders. <WH7926>
This is the plan <WH3289> that is determined <WH3289> for the whole earth. <WH776> This is the hand <WH3027> that is stretched out <WH5186> over all the nations. <WH1471>
For Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies <WH6635> has planned, <WH3289> and who can stop <WH6565> it? <WH3027> His hand is stretched out, <WH5186> and who can turn it back? <WH7725>"
This burden <WH4853> was in the year <WH8141> that king <WH4428> Ahaz <WH271> died. <WH4194>

Don't <WH8055> rejoice, O Philistia, <WH6429> all of you, <WH7626> because the rod that struck <WH5221> you is broken; <WH7665> for out <WH3318> of the serpent <WH5175>'s root <WH8328> an adder <WH6848> will emerge, <WH6529> and his fruit will be a fiery <WH8314> flying <WH5774> serpent. <WH8314>

The firstborn <WH1060> of the poor <WH1800> will eat, <WH7462> and the needy <WH34> will lie down <WH7257> in safety; <WH983> and I will kill <WH4191> your root <WH8328> with famine, <WH7458> and your remnant <WH7611> will be killed. <WH2026>

Howl, <WH3213> gate! <WH8179> Cry, <WH2199> city! <WH5892> You are melted <WH4127> away, <WH6429> Philistia, all of you; <WH6227> for smoke comes <WH935> out of the north, <WH6828> and there is no straggler <WH909> in his ranks. <WH4151>

What will they answer <WH6030> the messengers <WH4397> of the nation? <WH1471> That Yahweh <WH3068> has founded <WH3245> Zion, <WH6726> and in her the afflicted <WH6041> of his people <WH5971> will take refuge. <WH2620>
